scripts.name: Search for requests related to this article URL in web logs (Linux)
scripts.body:
# Replace access.log paths with your actual web server logs
grep -i "https://thehackernews.com/2026/02/cisa-flags-four-security-flaws-under.html" /var/log/nginx/access.log* /var/log/apache2/access.log* 2>/dev/null || echo "No hits for indicator"

scripts.name: AWS CLI: basic public S3 bucket exposure check
scripts.body:
# Requires configured AWS CLI with permissions to list and read S3 ACLs
aws s3api list-buckets --query "Buckets[].Name" --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read B; do
  echo "Bucket: $B"
  aws s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket "$B" --query "Grants[].Grantee.URI" --output text 2>/dev/null |
    egrep "AllUsers|AuthenticatedUsers" && echo "  [!] Bucket may be publicly accessible"
done

scripts.name: PowerShell: hunt for suspicious processes and autoruns
scripts.body:
Get-WmiObject Win32_Process |
  Where-Object { $_.Path -and ($_.Path -like "*AppData*" -or $_.Path -like "*Temp*") } |
  Select-Object ProcessId, Name, Path

Get-CimInstance Win32_StartupCommand |
  Select-Object Name, Command, Location

scripts.name: Linux: hunt for suspicious processes and SUID binaries
scripts.body:
ps aux | egrep "crypto|minerd|xmrig|kdevtmpfsi" | grep -v egrep || echo "No obvious miners found"

find / -xdev -type f -perm -4000 2>/dev/null

scripts.name: AWS CLI: basic public S3 bucket exposure check
scripts.body:
# Requires configured AWS CLI with permissions to list and read S3 ACLs
aws s3api list-buckets --query "Buckets[].Name" --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read B; do
  echo "Bucket: $B"
  aws s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket "$B" --query "Grants[].Grantee.URI" --output text 2>/dev/null |
    egrep "AllUsers|AuthenticatedUsers" && echo "  [!] Bucket may be publicly accessible"
done

scripts.name: Linux: hunt for suspicious processes and SUID binaries

scripts.name: AWS CLI: basic public S3 bucket exposure check
scripts.body:
# Requires configured AWS CLI with permissions to list and read S3 ACLs
aws s3api list-buckets --query "Buckets[].Name" --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read B; do
  echo "Bucket: $B"
  aws s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket "$B" --query "Grants[].Grantee.URI" --output text 2>/dev/null |
    egrep "AllUsers|AuthenticatedUsers" && echo "  [!] Bucket may be publicly accessible"
done

scripts.name: AWS CLI: basic public S3 bucket exposure check
scripts.body:
# Requires configured AWS CLI with permissions to list and read S3 ACLs
aws s3api list-buckets --query "Buckets[].Name" --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read B; do
  echo "Bucket: $B"
  aws s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket "$B" --query "Grants[].Grantee.URI" --output text 2>/dev/null |
    egrep "AllUsers|AuthenticatedUsers" && echo "  [!] Bucket may be publicly accessible"
done

scripts.name: AWS CLI: basic public S3 bucket exposure check
scripts.body:
# Requires configured AWS CLI with permissions to list and read S3 ACLs
aws s3api list-buckets --query "Buckets[].Name" --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read B; do
  echo "Bucket: $B"
  aws s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket "$B" --query "Grants[].Grantee.URI" --output text 2>/dev/null |
    egrep "AllUsers|AuthenticatedUsers" && echo "  [!] Bucket may be publicly accessible"
done
